thread.title: DeMar DeRozan drills game-winner to seal 4th straight come-from-behind win vs. Knicks
thread.title_full: DeMar DeRozan drills game-winner to seal 4th straight come-from-behind win vs. Knicks

title: DeMar DeRozan drills game-winner to seal 4th straight come-from-behind win vs. Knicks
text:
Feb 27, 2017 at 10:01p ET 0Shares 
The comeback kids did it again. Fresh off a dramatic 112-106 come-from-behind victory vs. the Portland Trail Blazers only 24 hours ago, the Toronto Raptors secured their 4th straight win in which they were trailing at some point in the second half. 
Down 13 at halftime, with his all-star running mate Kyle Lowry sidelined with a wrist injury , it was DeMar DeRozan who stepped up once again to seal the victory in the clutch — nailing not one… Straight Cash, Homie pic.twitter.com/5nL1JogM1J 
— Toronto Raptors (@Raptors) February 28, 2017 
but two cold-blooded daggers, the second of which gave the Raptors the lead for good:
